meaningMnemonic: There’s an <radical>arrow</radical> in that <radical>turkey</radical> and you do everything in your <radical>power</radical> to <kanji>recommend</kanji> that we don’t eat the turkey. There’s an arrow in this turkey. The arrow looks a little broken, so there’s probably splinters all up inside that turkey. I know you’re all hungry but I can’t recommend eating this bird.
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>recommend</kanji> the Genghis <reading>Khan</reading> (かん) special instead of this arrow-tainted turkey! When it comes out, your heart sinks. Genghis Khan apparently ate a cow with an arrow broken off in it.
